media:group.media:title: Winning the Other War
media:group.media:description:
Arda Nazerian Haratunian, a strategic communications advisor who serves as a board member at the Armenian General Benevolent Union and a founding board member at The Armenia Project, sits down with CivilNetโs Mark Dovich to talk about the crucial issue of messaging โ what Armenia gets wrong, and what Armenia needs to do to get its message out to the world.

ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีธึีด ีกีฏีฟีซีพีธึีฅีถ ึีถีถีกึีฏีพีธึีด ีฅีถ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซี ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีซึ ีทึีปีพีฅีฌีธึ ีฏีกีด ีกีทีญีกึีฐีกึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีทึีปีกีคีกึีฑ ีฏีกีฟีกึีฅีฌีธึ ีฐีฅีฟึีกีถึีถีฅึีจ: ีีซีดีถีกีฏีกีถีธึีด ีญีธีฝีพีธึีด ีง ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ึ ีกีถีพีฟีกีถีฃีกีตีซีถ ีญีถีคีซึีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ, ีธึีธีถึ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีฅีถ ีฎีกีฃีฅีฌี ีฝีฟีพีฅึีฅีฌีธีพ ีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีกึีฉีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ: ีีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฅีฏีกีดีธึีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฏีธีดีซีฟีฅีซ ีถีกีญีฏีซีถ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ิดีกีพีซีฉ ิฑีถีกีถีตีกีถีจ ีพีฝีฟีกีฐ ีงี ีกีทีญีกึีฐีกึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีทึีปีกีคีกึีฑีซ ีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีพีถีกีฝีถีฅึีจ ึ ีคึีกีถึ ึีธีญีฐีกีฟีธึึีดีกีถ ีฟีกึีขีฅึีกีฏีถีฅึีจ ีฐีกีทีพีกึีฏีพีกีฎ ีนีฅีถ: ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีซึ ีดีฅีฎ ีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีกีญีพีกีฎีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีถีฅึีธึีด ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีฟึีธึีฏ ึีธึีธีญีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ ีฎีกีถึ ีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีฅีฟึีกีถึีถีฅึ ีฅีถ ีธึีถีฅีถีกีฌีธึ, ีฏีกึีฎีธึีด ีง ีถีก:

entry.title: European Parliament calls for sanctions on Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: European Parliament calls for sanctions on Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
๐Yerevan was ready to sign a โlandmark documentโ with Baku before Azerbaijanโs Ilham Aliyev pulled out of a planned meeting today, Armeniaโs Nikol Pashinyan said. ๐Germanyโs Olaf Scholz spoke by phone with Aliyev to reiterate his support for an Armenia-Azerbaijan negotiating track coordinated by the European Union. ๐The European Parliament voted overwhelmingly to adopt a non-binding resolution calling for the EU to step up support for Armenia and impose sanctions on Azerbaijan. ๐The Armenian government set aside $19 million to support the more than 100,000 people forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh. ๐A group of unidentified individuals vandalized Armeniaโs only synagogue.

entry.title: World Visionโs humanitarian strategies for Armenia and Karabakh

media:group.media:title: World Visionโs humanitarian strategies for Armenia and Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
World Visionโs Regional Humanitarian and Emergency Affairs Director Julian Srodecki sits down with CivilNet to discuss how the organizationโs local office is scaling up humanitarian efforts in Armenia. He speaks with CivilNet about their activities aimed at helping the displaced persons who fled Nagorno-Karabakh, collaborations with the local government and organizations, and strategies to prepare for the winter months. He emphasized the importance of quickly coordinating the placement of upwards of 30,000 displaced children of Nagorno-Karabakh to educational institutions.

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan detains senior Karabakh officials
media:group.media:description:
๐Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev pulled out of talks planned for tomorrow with Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and the leaders of France, Germany, and the EU. ๐Top officials from the EU, U.S., and Russia met in Turkey for previously undisclosed emergency talks on Karabakh just days before Azerbaijan launched its offensive last month, Politico reported. ๐France plans to sell weapons to Armenia, the two countriesโ foreign ministers confirmed. ๐Armeniaโs parliament voted to join the International Criminal Court, ignoring repeated and unusually strong warnings from Russia about the consequences of doing so. ๐Azerbaijan detained former Karabakh Presidents Arkadi Ghukasyan, Bako Sahakyan, and Arayik Harutyunyan, as well as Davit Ishkanyan, the ex-parliament speaker. ๐Kristinne Grigoryan, Armeniaโs former human rights defender, will head the countryโs newly formed Foreign Intelligence Service.
Credits: Ruptly
